A scoring record of 32 years fell at West M on Jan. 6. Here's how.
description: Ryan Morrison might have spoken his son's big scoring night into existence prior to West Muskingum's boys hoops game against Crooksville on Feb. 6.
fullText:
FALLS TOWNSHIP ‚Äî Steve Mitchell's single-game scoring record at West Muskingum stood for 32 years, a 44-point explosion against Jay Burson's John Glenn squad that won a Muskingum Valley League title.

It was Jan. 14, 1984, and the Muskies put up 98 in a game Burson and Mitchell combined for 83.

Now Noah Morrison carries the mantle.

Morrison, a 6-1 sophomore guard, fired in six 3s among his career-high 45 points in the Tornadoes' 93-39 win on Feb. 6 against visiting Crooksville at Gary Ankrum Gymnasium, establishing a new single-game scoring record at a place that hasn't been short on scorers in its history.

More: Defense becomes 'heart and guts' for West M basketball under Cole Smith

More: 'Always been a scrapper': West M hooper still fighting after torn ACL

More: 'Elite level' Jordyn Watson shines as Maysville slays another giant

Morrison had 30 of the team's first 65 points, then added 11 

With the game well in hand, he left shortly after splitting two free throws to secure his place in history.

"It was crazy," Morrison said of the turn of events.

Crazy, or creepy? Morrison said one night earlier, after returning home from a shooting session with his personal coach, he was having a conversation with his father, Ryan, who asked a random question.

"He asked, 'you ever thinking about breaking a scoring record in a game?' Noah recalled. "And then it happens."

As with most big scoring nights, shooting was at the forefront. Noah hit his first two 3s in the first quarter en route to 13 points. When he had seven baskets in the second, a quarter in which West put up 34 points, it was clear this was no ordinary game.

"When I made those first two I knew it was going to be a good night for me," Noah said. "I told Coach (Cole) Smith that I was feeling it, and he said to keep shooting it. I had 30 at the half and everybody was like, man you need that record. I said, 'it's about the win.' ... I was just in shock. I don't think anyone ever expects to have a game like that. It's insane."

Once it was over, naturally he found his dad, who was waiting for him.

"He gave me a hug after we were shaking hands and I was kind of crying," Noah said. "But they weren't sad tears; they were tears of joy. We were both so happy."

Smith and top assistant Jeff Nezbeth had one of the best views of Noah's play, which has been on the ascent for weeks during the team's 10-game winning streak that left it at 15-4.

He entered the Crooksville game at 12.2 points per game while leading the team in field goal shooting (54%), three-point shooting (44%) and steals (3.2).

Smith said "it was only a matter of time" before Noah had a dominant effort like the one produced in front of the home crowd, some who likely were there when Mitchell had his night of fame. He averaged 25.1 points per game that season.

"He created so many scoring opportunities from being in the passing lanes, and then offensively he just found his spots and shot the ball with extreme confidence," Smith said. "I‚Äôm very happy for him, but I‚Äôm not surprised this happened because of all the work I‚Äôve seen him put in the last couple years. Awesome night for sure, and seeing the entire team celebrate him was great to see."

Noah joked that there was probably no way he would be able to sleep with the amount of adrenaline rushing through his body after the game. But Smith scheduled an early morning practice to ensure the team's eyes remained on the prize.

Specifically, it's the potential for a strong tournament season. First, though, are games with Tri-Valley, Meadowbrook and Maysville to end the regular season.

The latter figures to be a true measuring stick of just how far Noah and his teammates have come since December. Speaking of the Panthers, Noah's big game was the second 45-point game produced by an MVL team in the last five days and fourth of at least 40 in the past three weeks ‚Äî Maysville's Jordyn Watson had 45 against Cleveland Heights Lutheran East and teammate Gator Nichols 42 at Tri-Valley and 40 at Meadowbrook.

"It's a big game for us, really good competition going into the tournament," Noah said. "Them, Meadowbrook and Tri-Valley is a really good stretch for us to prepare."

sblackbu@gannett.com; X: @SamBlackburnTR

This article originally appeared on Zanesville Times Recorder: West M sophomore breaks three-decade old scoring record vs Crooksville

title: Johnson boys basketball manager receives special honor on senior night
description: As Johnson celebrated senior night for the boys basketball team, the team manager received a special honor.
fullText:
SAVANNAH, Ga. (WSAV) ‚Äî As Johnson celebrated senior night for the boys basketball team, the team manager received a special honor.

Rico McNabb has been the boys‚Äô team manager for the last four years. His goal is to play college basketball, but because of a medical condition, he will not be able to fulfill his dream.

Johnson boys‚Äô basketball coach Chuck Campbell wanted to make McNabb‚Äôs senior night special. Johnson, who refers to McNabb as the team‚Äôs sixth man, had McNabb suit.

He was on the floor for the opening tip for the game against Beach. McNabb scored the first points of the contest between Johnson and Beach.

McNabb is really smart and is part of the International Baccalaureate program at Johnson, according to Campbell.

McNabb will be a basketball manager when he attends college, according to Campbell.

title: Scott Barlow, 2025 Reds reliever, reaches deal with Athletics | Report
description: Relief pitcher Scott Barlow, who signed a one-year deal with the Reds about one year ago, reportedly is headed to the Athletics.
fullText:
Free-agent relief pitcher Scott Barlow, who made 75 appearances for the Cincinnati Reds in 2025, reached a one-year, $2 million contract with the Athletics that includes $1.3 million in performance bonuses, according to a report via Twitter/X from Robert Murray.

Barlow signed a one-year, $2.5 million deal with the Reds about one year ago.

Barlow posted a 4.21 ERA with 75 strikeouts and 45 walks in 68 1/3 innings for the Reds in his eighth big-league season. He had one save, and his start for Cincinnati in September was the first of his MLB career.

The Reds announced in Nov. 2025 they declined their contract options on Suter and fellow reliever Scott Barlow, as well as outfielder Austin Hays. Hays reached a one-year deal with the Chicago White Sox; Suter signed a one-year deal with the Angels.

This article originally appeared on Cincinnati Enquirer: Scott Barlow, 2025 Reds reliever, reaches deal with Athletics | Report

title: Rachel Vickio scores 1,000th career point
description: WATKINS GLEN, N.Y. (WETM) ‚Äì Watkins Glen senior guard Rachel Vickio achieved a major accomplishment Friday night. Vickio scored her 1,000th career point in Watkins Glen‚Äôs big win over Whitney Point on Senior Night. It was a perfect moment to share with family, friends and teammates for Vickio at the Lake Hawks‚Äô home gym.
fullText:
WATKINS GLEN, N.Y. (WETM) ‚Äì Watkins Glen senior guard Rachel Vickio achieved a major accomplishment Friday night.

Vickio scored her 1,000th career point in Watkins Glen‚Äôs big win over Whitney Point on Senior Night. It was a perfect moment to share with family, friends and teammates for Vickio at the Lake Hawks‚Äô home gym. Vickio scored 14 points on the historic night in her final season in Watkins Glen before she takes her talent to Elmira College for basketball.

Watkins Glen topped Whitney Point 43-39 in a tight battle which saw the Lake Hawks hang on for the victory.

Next up for the Lake Hawks is a home game vs. Newark Valley Tuesday at 7 pm.

title: Yankees news: Could Jasson Dom√≠nguez land at Triple-A Scranton?
description: Is The Martian headed to Triple-A to start 2026?; a look at the Yanks‚Äô roster as spring nears; can Grisham do it again?
fullText:
MLB | Bryan Hoch: As Jasson Dom√≠nguez‚Äôs playing time cratered in the second half last season, the Yanks considered sending the former blue-chip prospect down to Triple-A to get consistent playing time. Ultimately, they opted not to. But that doesn‚Äôt mean El Marciano is guaranteed a big league roster spot in 2026. On Thursday in fact, Jon Heyman reported he was set to start 2026 in Triple-A, ‚Äúbarring something unforeseen.‚Äù

Although an injury opening a spot for Dom√≠nguez doesn‚Äôt feel like that much of a reach, it‚Äôs still worth noting that reading between the lines of what GM Brian Cashman and manager Aaron Boone say in the article, it feels like they‚Äôre trying to tamp down expectations for The Martian as Opening Day approaches.

The Athletic | Brendan Kuty ($): Spring training nears. And the Yankees roster takes shape. Most of the roster seems settled but there are some position battles that should play out this spring. The Yankees bench could still use a right-handed hitting outfielder. Oswaldo Cabrera will return from his season-ending injury last season, but Ozzie is a better hitter from the left side. In the bullpen, what is the plan with Paul Blackburn? And can Jake Bird find his form? We still have a couple week before spring training games begin so there is plenty of runway remaining for the Yanks to make moves before Opening Day.

MLB | Bryan Hoch: One spot not up for grabs is center field. That belongs firmly to Trent Grisham, who accepted the Yanks‚Äô qualifying offer, keeping him in pinstripes to start the 2026 season. Grisham had a breakout 2025 season, setting personal career highs in several offensive statistics. Now, having extended the QO and having had him accept it, the Yankees hope Grisham has an encore performance in him.

title: Grant scores 23 points to help Trail Blazers rout Grizzlies, 135-115
description: Jerami Grant had 23 points and the Portland Trail Blazers snapped a six-game losing streak, beating the Memphis Grizzlies 135-115 on Friday night to open a two-game set.  The teams will meet again Saturday night in Portland.  Jrue Holiday had 20 points and seven assists for the Blazers, who led by 30 points after pulling away in the second half.
fullText:
PORTLAND (AP) ‚Äî Jerami Grant had 23 points and the Portland Trail Blazers snapped a six-game losing streak, beating the Memphis Grizzlies 135-115 on Friday night to open a two-game set.

The teams will meet again Saturday night in Portland.

Jrue Holiday had 20 points and seven assists for the Blazers, who led by 30 points after pulling away in the second half. Eight Portland players finished in double figures.

Cam Spencer had 18 points off the bench for the Grizzlies, who had won their previous two straight after a six-game losing streak. GG Jackson II added 15.

Ja Morant missed his eighth straight game with left elbow injury. Morant remained with the team at Thursday's trade deadline despite speculation the Grizzlies might move him.

The Grizzlies were adjusting to a sweeping trade that sent Jaren Jackson Jr., Jock Landale, John Konchar and Vince Williams Jr. to Utah in exchange for Georges Niang, Kyle Anderson, Walter Clayton Jr. and Taylor Hendricks.

Anderson was out Friday because of illness but Clayton and Hendricks came in off the bench for Memphis.

The Grizzlies led 15 points in the opening half but Portland tied the game at 51 on Jerami Grant's dunk. Grant followed with a layup that gave the Blazers the lead and they were ahead 68-64 at the half.

The Blazers said at halftime that Shaedon Sharpe would not return with a sore left calf.

Portland extended the lead to 94-77 on Grant's 3-pointer in the third quarter and Memphis never challenged.

Scotty Pippen Jr. started in his first game of the season for Memphis after undergoing surgery on his left big toe. He had 13 points and six assists in 22 minutes.

Portland guard Scoot Henderson also played in his first game of the season after recovering from an offseason left hamstring injury. He had 11 points, nine assists and five rebounds in just over 21 minutes.

Donovan Clingan finished with 13 points and 17 rebounds for Portland.

NBA: https://apnews.com/hub/nba

title: What time is Super Bowl 2026? Patriots vs. Seahawks TV schedule, channel, live stream to watch Super Bowl 60
description: All you need to know to watch Super Bowl 60 between the Patriots and Seahawks.
fullText:
What time is Super Bowl 2026? Patriots vs. Seahawks TV schedule, channel, live stream to watch Super Bowl 60 originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Super Bowl 60 will evoke memories of the classic battle between the New England Patriots and Seattle Seahawks on the same stage 11 years earlier, but make no mistake: these are fresh faces taking the field in Santa Clara.

This Super Bowl is the first in 13 years to feature two head coaches and two starting quarterbacks without Super Bowl experience in their roles. While Patriots coach Mike Vrabel won three Super Bowls as a player and Seahawks QB Sam Darnold was on hand for one as a backup, the experience level of these two teams isn't close to what it was for the participants of the last Super Bowl between these two teams.

Patriots QB Drake Maye in particular is a new face on the Super Bowl stage, as he will become the second-youngest quarterback in NFL history to start a Super Bowl at just 23 and was still in high school when Tom Brady left New England six years ago.

While the quarterbacks will receive the bulk of the attention, the Patriots and Seahawks bring two vaunted defenses shaped in the image of their defensive-minded head coach. Points could be at a premium, but nothing is guaranteed as a wild NFL season comes to a close.

Here's what you need to know to watch the Super Bowl, including start time and TV info.

Super Bowl 60 will kickoff at about 6:30 p.m. ET (3:30 p.m. local time) from Levi's Stadium in Santa Clara, California.

For Seahawks fans and anyone else tuning in on the west coast, where the game is being played, Super Bowl 60 will start at 3:30 p.m. PT.

Fans in the Central Time Zone don't have the Kansas City Chiefs in the Super Bowl this year, but they can expect to see Super Bowl 60 kick off at 5:30 p.m. CT.

For fans in the mountain time zone, the Super Bowl kicks off at 4:30 p.m. MT.

Super Bowl 60 will be broadcast nationally on NBC, with Mike Tirico (play-by-play) and Cris Collinsworth (color analyst) on the call. Melissa Stark and Kaylee Hartung will serve as sideline reporters for the game.

The Super Bowl will be live streamed on Peacock, NBC's streaming service. Fans without cable or fans who simply prefer to stream the game can find it live on the platform on Sunday.

Radio channels:SiriusXM¬†channels 225, 226

Fans can listen to Super Bowl 60 live on¬†SiriusXM. Coverage will be available on channels 225 (Patriots broadcast) and 226 (Seahawks broadcast).

Listen to every NFL Game live on¬†SiriusXM, where new¬†subscribers can start with a free first month. Subscriptions include live play-by-play for the NFL, college football, MLB, NBA, NHL, NASCAR, and more. Get 24/7 coverage with news and analysis from¬†SiriusXM¬†NFL Radio and other sport-specific channels.

title: Former Marquette star Kam Jones returns to Fiserv Forum with Pacers
description: Kam Jones played 13 minutes against the Bucks and flashed some of the skills that made him a star at Marquette.
fullText:
Kam Jones played 65 games at Fiserv Forum over his four seasons with the Marquette men's basketball team.

But he found himself in an unfamiliar part of the building on Feb. 6 in his first game as a rookie with the Indiana Pacers, sitting in the cramped visiting team's locker room after a 105-99 loss to the Milwaukee Bucks.

"It was a lot of fun," Jones said. "It was a lot of fun just getting off the plane and inhale that Milwaukee air.

"It's always good to land here and think about all the time I've had here. Came here with the intent to win. I don't think I played as good as I'm capable of. But we got another game coming up."

The NBA grind doesn't slow down. But this stop did allow Jones to make a quick visit to a MU practice to talk with the team. He misses his time with the Golden Eagles.

Welcome back, @csgkam!#MUBB | #WeAreMarquette pic.twitter.com/rKWH67G7xw

‚Äî Marquette Basketball (@MarquetteMBB) February 7, 2026

"It's crazy," Jones said. "I feel like it will sink in a little later.

"Now, it still hurts me. I feel like it wasn't that long ago. I definitely think in the years to come it's going to hurt even worse. But I'm very grateful for the time I've had here. It's actually crazy, I've never seen this locker room ever. As much time as I spent (at Fiserv Forum)."

Jones provided a brief flashback to his time at MU during his 13 minutes. In his first stint, he made one of his signature shots in the paint with a kiss off the glass. He followed that up with a deflection on the defensive end.

It wasn't an ideal start to his rookie season. There was a hubbub when Jones was arrested in October for reckless driving and resisting law enforcement, but prosecutors never filed charges and Pacers head coach Rick Carlisle said it was merely a speeding ticket.

Jones also had a back injury that kept him from making his NBA debut until Dec. 22.

"It cost him two months at the beginning of the year," Carlisle said. "That was an obstacle.

"But since being cleared, he's made gradual improvments with conditioning, with familiarity with the NBA game. He's had a lot of good G League stints.

"Those of you that know him from Marquette know he was in one of the best programs in the country with one of the best coaches with Shaka (Smart). From a basketball IQ standpoint, moxie, feel for the game, character, competitive integrity, I mean, he's tremendous."

During the game, Carlisle stopped Jones and asked him how many points he averaged in the building in an effort to get the rookie to play loose.

"That definitely makes me feel a little bit better," Jones said. "Sometimes when I'm out there on the floor I kind of try to play mistake free. Just me being a rookie and wanting to do my job.

"And not really try things because I don't want to mess them up. But he kind of took me back to my roots. I never played well that way. He kind of set me back to, yeah, it's just basketball. This is what I do. And then right after that I was in a more aggressive mind-state. Got the ball, took it down there and got an easy layup."

Jones has had to make adjustments to his game in the NBA.

"Especially as a rook coming in, you got to learn how to impact the game in a lot of different ways in a lot more short spans," Jones said. "I don't have the ball obviously nearly as much as I did at Marquette.

"Which is normal. Which is natural. Got to just find ways to plug and play. Plug in and do good things for us."

The quick trip back to Milwaukee made Jones thankful for his four seasons at MU.

"Wouldn't be here without them," Jones said. "Definitely needed every season. Thankful I stayed all four seasons, for sure."

This article originally appeared on Milwaukee Journal Sentinel: Former Marquette star Kam Jones returns to Fiserv Forum with Pacers

title: Manchester United vs Tottenham Hotspur: Live stream, Time & How to watch
description: Manchester United will be looking to make it four wins out of four under interim boss Michael Carrick when they welcome Tottenham Hotspur to Old Trafford for an intriguing Premier League clash on Saturday lunchtime. The two teams butt heads for the first time since August when Matthijs de Ligt scored a 96th-minute equaliser for [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
Manchester United will be looking to make it four wins out of four under interim boss Michael Carrick when they welcome Tottenham Hotspur to Old Trafford for an intriguing Premier League clash on Saturday lunchtime.

The two teams butt heads for the first time since August when Matthijs de Ligt scored a 96th-minute equaliser for the Red Devils in a 2-2 draw in North London.

It is fair to say that Man United have turned a corner since the departure of Ruben Amorim and arrival of Carrick, with the Red Devils picking up nine points from a possible nine available under their new boss and extending their unbeaten Premier League run to seven matches (W4 D3).

United are unbeaten in all nine of their Premier League matches this season when they have had less possession than their opponents (W7 D2), prevailing in all seven when having less than 45%. In contrast, they have won only four of their 15 top-flight games when in control of +50% of the ball (D6 L5).

A win for the Red Devils against Tottenham would also see them claim four consecutive victories for the first time since February 2024 under Erik ten Hag. However, success against Spurs has been hard to come by in recent years, with United failing to win any of their last six league encounters with the North Londoners (D3 L3) ‚Äì their joint-longest run without a win against them (also six between 1914 and 1921).

United duo Patrick Dorgu and De Ligt remain sidelined with respective thigh and back injuries, while this weekend‚Äôs game will come too soon for Mason Mount who recently picked up a knock in training.

Carrick is expected to stick with his winning formula and not make wholesale changes to his starting lineup, but he may be tempted to recall Sesko in attack after his impact as a substitute last time out. That would result in one of Bryan Mbeumo, Amad Diallo or Matheus Cunha making way, though.

Captain Bruno Fernandes has registered more assists than any other Premier League player so this season, with his 12 also his joint-best tally in a single campaign (level with 2020-21). The playmaker is expected to continue in an advanced central role behind the central striker.

It‚Äôs a half past noon kickoff in the UK, which means a 7:30 a.m. kickoff on the East Coast of the U.S.

The match is on Sky Sports Premier League in the UK. Those Stateside can watch on USA or NBC Streaming streaming. In Canada, it‚Äôs on DAZN and Fubo.

Everyone else, head on over to¬†LiveSoccerTV¬†to find your viewing options.

Manchester United possible starting lineup:¬†Lammens; Dalot, Maguire, Martinez, Shaw; Mainoo, Casemiro; Diallo, Fernandes, Mbeumo; Cunha

title: Backlift like Brian Lara, world champion at 14: The rise and rise of unconventional Vaibhav Sooryavanshi
description: Still two-years younger than what Sachin Tendulkar's age was at the time of his India debut, he has a bat-swing that reminds of Brian Charles Lara, Harmanpreet Kaur, and Yuvraj Singh, and like footballer Lamine Yamal, who has emerged as a teenage sensation at the highest level, Sooryavanshi‚Äôs age has rarely matched the stage he performs on.
fullText:
Conventional wisdom suggests that a 13-year-old would struggle to even face deliveries bowled at speeds above 90 mph. Vaibhav Sooryavanshi has challenged that assumption by striking bowlers such as Mohammed Siraj, Prasidh Krishna and Jofra Archer to all parts of the ground.

In traditional cricket coaching, batters are taught to keep their hands close to the body during the backlift to maintain control over the bat swing. Sooryavanshi differs here as well. His backlift moves away from the body, going against what is often described as textbook technique.

Still two-years younger than what Sachin Tendulkar's age was at the time of his India debut, he has a bat-swing that reminds of Brian Charles Lara, Harmanpreet Kaur, and Yuvraj Singh; and like footballer Lamine Yamal, who has emerged as a teenage sensation at the highest level, Sooryavanshi‚Äôs age has rarely matched the stage and level he performs on.

Talent could never be the question with Vaibhav Sooryavanshi. It never was. With the 80-ball 175 knock against England in the Under-19 World Cup final on Friday, he also put to rest any talks of temperament too, with delivering on the biggest of stages.

Sooryavanshi produced what can be counted among the most dominant innings in Under-19 World Cup history. His 175, which included 15 sixes, helped India post 411 for 9 against England in the final at Harare.

England, under pressure after Sooryavanshi‚Äôs innings, were bowled out for 311 in 40.2 overs while chasing a target of 412 against India‚Äôs bowling attack.

The 14-year-old reached his century in 55 balls, becoming the second-fastest centurion in the history of the Under-19 World Cup.

His innings is the highest individual score in an Under-19 World Cup final and came in the match that also produced the highest team total in a final of the tournament.

Sooryavanshi reached his first fifty in 32 balls and continued at the same pace against the England bowlers. His second fifty came off 23 balls.

Out of his 175 runs, 150 came through boundaries, with 15 sixes and an equal number of fours. During this phase, India‚Äôs scoring rate stayed close to 10 runs an over, and the projected total crossed 500 midway through the innings.

He now holds the record for most sixes in a Youth ODI innings, surpassing his own mark of 14 sixes against UAE at ICCA Dubai in December.

Sooryavanshi also owns the record for the fastest 150 in Under-19 cricket, reaching the mark in 71 balls. The previous record was held by England‚Äôs Ben Mayes, who took 98 balls against Scotland at the same venue earlier in the tournament.

Vedant Trivedi, batting at the other end, faced only four deliveries between Sooryavanshi‚Äôs 100 and 150, underlining the speed at which the runs were scored.

Sooryavanshi first came into wider attention in November 2024 when he became the youngest player to receive an IPL contract after Rajasthan Royals signed him for Rs 1.10 crore. He was 13 years and 243 days old at the time. By then, he had already represented India Under-19 and scored a century as an opener against Australia Under-19 in a four-day match in Chennai.

One of the early highlights of his career was the 58-ball century against Australia Under-19, where he scored 104. At 13 years and 187 days, he became the youngest player to score a century in youth cricket, breaking the previous record held by Bangladesh captain Najmul Hossain Shanto.

In the following months, Sooryavanshi continued to add records. On April 19, 2025, he made his IPL debut for Rajasthan Royals against Lucknow Super Giants, hitting Shardul Thakur for a six over extra cover off his first ball. He scored 34 off 20 balls in that match.

In his third IPL appearance, he scored a 35-ball century against Gujarat Titans, whose bowling attack included Mohammed Siraj, Ishant Sharma and Rashid Khan. The hundred was the second-fastest in IPL history, behind only Chris Gayle‚Äôs 30-ball century in 2013.

In July 2025, Sooryavanshi recorded the fastest Youth ODI century at the time, reaching the milestone in 52 balls. That record was later broken by Pakistan‚Äôs Sameer Minhas, who scored a century off 42 balls against Zimbabwe Under-19.

He was named Bihar‚Äôs vice-captain for the first two rounds of the 2025‚Äì26 Ranji Trophy season in October. The decision followed his performances on India Under-19's tour of Australia, where he provided quick starts and scored a 78-ball century in the first four-day match in Brisbane. He finished as the second-highest run-scorer of the series, with 133 runs in three innings as India won 2-0.

In November 2025, Sooryavanshi scored 144 off 42 balls for India A against UAE in the Asia Cup Rising Stars. His century came off 32 balls and was then the joint-third fastest by an Indian in men‚Äôs T20 cricket.

A few weeks later, he scored 171 off 95 balls against UAE Under-19 in the opening match of the Under-19 Asia Cup.

At 14 years and 272 days, Sooryavanshi became the youngest player to score a century in men‚Äôs List A cricket. He achieved the feat while playing for Bihar against Arunachal Pradesh in the 2025‚Äì26 Vijay Hazare Trophy. He reached his century in 36 balls, later scoring the fastest 150 in men‚Äôs List A cricket off 59 balls. He was dismissed for 190 off 84 balls, which included 16 fours and 15 sixes.

Sooryavanshi scored 439 runs and took 1 wicket in the Under-19 World Cup and was named Player of the Tournament after India won their sixth Under-19 World Cup title on Friday.

"I had faith in my skills that I can contribute in big games and today it happened," Sooryavanshi said at the post-match presentation.

At 14, Sooryavanshi is already a world champion. He has delivered on most opportunities given to him so far. But he's still a kid. It's important to give him space and not put too many expectations on him. Leave him freely and watch him take the cricketing world by storm.

title: Sources: Lakers won't pursue 'single pathway' this summer
description: Will it be Giannis Antetokounmpo or bust this summer for the Lakers?
fullText:
The NBA's trade deadline came and went on Thursday with Giannis Antetokounmpo staying put on the Milwaukee Bucks' roster. That means that once this summer starts, he will be highly sought after once again, and perhaps this time, the attempts to trade for him will be very serious.

The Minnesota Timberwolves, Miami Heat and New York Knicks are thought to be the three teams that have the best chances of landing the two-time MVP. Lurking in the shadows, despite a lack of players who will be attractive trade assets, are the Los Angeles Lakers.

The Lakers will have plenty of salary cap space, as well as three tradable first-round draft picks (one of which is this year's first-rounder) this summer. But some fans may fear that the organization will be so fixated on Antetokounmpo that should it strike out on him, it will miss out on other trade targets, as well as free agents who could help it.

According to Dan Woike of The Athletic, Los Angeles may be a little more flexible as far as how it goes about upgrading its roster.

"Team sources have maintained that the Lakers won‚Äôt pursue a single pathway. That‚Äôs the luxury of their position; they can and should pursue Antetokounmpo. They can and should explore high-level role players whom they can trade draft picks for and absorb into space. They can and should look into aggressive ways to pry loose one of the top restricted free agents."

This year's free agent class won't be impressive, but it will include Peyton Watson and Tari Eason, who are two-way forwards capable of bringing L.A. closer to championship contention. It could always make another attempt at trading for Trey Murphy III, another two-way forward whom it reportedly had interest in prior to the trade deadline. Or there could be another difference-maker who isn't on people's radars right now.

The Lakers could have over $50 million of salary cap space after the conclusion of this season. That would at least give them the ability to truly reshape their roster around and for Luka Doncic, even if fans lack confidence that general manager Rob Pelinka will be successful in doing so.

This article originally appeared on LeBron Wire: Sources: Lakers won't pursue 'single pathway' this summer

title: Avery Neff wins the all-around and leads Utah past Arizona on the road
description: There were a lot of checked boxes on Friday night as the 15th-ranked Utah gymnastics team defeated Arizona 197.125-195.975.  The Red Rocks had the solid start they wanted, and arguably¬†deserved an even better bars score from the judges than 49.25.
fullText:
There were a lot of checked boxes on Friday night as the 15th-ranked Utah gymnastics team defeated Arizona 197.125-195.975.

The Red Rocks had the solid start they wanted, and arguably¬†deserved an even better bars score from the judges than 49.25.

They also were able to carry over their momentum from bars and keep rolling with an even better result on vault (49.40).

Maybe most importantly, they showed they can score in the 197.000 range even with some mistakes across events.

‚ÄúOne of our goals was to score over a 197.000, and obviously we did that on the road, which is a really big step for us,‚Äù said Utah coach Carly Dockendorf.

The final score was the Red Rocks‚Äô second-best of the season and their best since Jan. 12.

On bars, it was the latter part of the lineup that led the way, as Ella Zirbes, Ana Padurariu and Avery Neff reeled off three 9.90s in a row to tie for the event title.

That closing effort helped Utah avoid counting both of its earlier scores under 9.725.

Zirbes was even better in her next effort to win vault with a 9.925, while Zoe Johnson had a 9.9. The Red Rocks didn‚Äôt produce a score lower than 9.85 on vault, including their throw away.

‚ÄúVault was so fun to watch tonight,‚Äù Dockendorf said. ‚ÄúThe crowd was into it, the team was into it and just amazing execution and much better control on our landings.

‚ÄúZoe‚Äôs vault was just massive, and (she) stuck that cold.‚Äù

The box Utah didn‚Äôt get to check off was a solid four-event meet because floor couldn‚Äôt match its outcome from a week ago.

The Red Rocks finished with a 48.925 after some missteps on landings, including an out of bounds deduction from Johnson and some lower scores, one of which (Makenna Smith‚Äôs 9.75) is being queried to learn why it was scored so low.

While the event didn‚Äôt go the way Utah wanted it to, another checked box was the Red Rocks‚Äô response to the mistakes.

‚ÄúI think this (meet) was a big step for us tonight,‚Äù Dockendorf said. ‚ÄúPart of that big step was we still did make mistakes, but it was how we responded.‚Äù

The response to floor was beam, and it was a good one as the Red Rocks delivered their highest beam score of the season at 49.550.

Utah‚Äôs beamers who hit were solid from start to finish, and those in the bottom of the lineup didn‚Äôt flinch after Sara Krump fell in the third spot.

Padurariu‚Äôs answer earned her a 9.925, but her great routine was quickly one-upped by her teammates Neff and Camie Winger, who both recorded 9.95s.

Their career-tying performances earned them a shared event title.

Overall, Neff was very good Friday as she won the all-around with a 39.625. The sophomore standout has had a few bumps in the road this season and a few big highlights, including recording the first 10.0 of the year in the country early in January.

Her ceiling is high and it seems like she has found her groove to get there.

‚ÄúSometimes it takes a few meets to remind yourself of what you need,‚Äù Dockendorf said. ‚ÄúI really think she‚Äôs putting her formula together to do what we all know Avery Neff can do.‚Äù

All-Around¬†‚Äî¬†Avery Neff (Utah); 39.625

Vault¬†‚Äî Ella Zirbes (Utah); 9.925

Bars¬†‚Äî¬†Ella Zirbes, Ana Padurariu and Avery Neff (Utah); 9.90

Beam¬†‚Äî¬†Avery Neff and Camie Winger (Utah); 9.95

Floor¬†‚Äî¬†Avery Neff (Utah), Emma Strom (Arizona), 9.9

Utah is back at the Huntsman Center to host No. 23 BYU next Friday.

title: Lufkin wins share of district title after 60-39 win over Mount Pleasant
description: MOUNT PLEASANT, Texas (KETK) ‚Äî The Lufkin Panthers made their way to Mount Pleasant on Friday night, looking to clinch a share of the district championship for the 5th season in a row. It was a packed house, but the Pack came out on top, beating the Tigers 60-39, to remain unbeaten in district play. [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
MOUNT PLEASANT, Texas (KETK) ‚Äî The Lufkin Panthers made their way to Mount Pleasant on Friday night, looking to clinch a share of the district championship for the 5th season in a row.

Austin Brown and the Lufkin Panthers beat Whitehouse 73-32

It was a packed house, but the Pack came out on top, beating the Tigers 60-39, to remain unbeaten in district play.

The Panthers will finish the regular season with two home games, hosting the Marshall Mavericks and the Jacksonville Indians.

title: HIGHLIGHTS: No. 13 Rambelles split home-opening doubleheader with Missouri Western, Ouachita Baptist
description: SAN ANGELO, Texas (Concho Valley Homepage) ‚Äî The Angelo State Rambelles played their season home openers on Friday, Feb 6. Day one of Angelo State‚Äôs annual George & Ola McCorkle Challenge was a tale of two halves. The Rambelles‚Äô opening game versus Missouri Western was a scoreless tie through six full innings, until the top [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
SAN ANGELO, Texas (Concho Valley Homepage) ‚Äî The Angelo State Rambelles played their season home openers on Friday, Feb 6.

Day one of Angelo State‚Äôs annual George & Ola McCorkle Challenge was a tale of two halves. The Rambelles‚Äô opening game versus Missouri Western was a scoreless tie through six full innings, until the top of the seventh inning when the Griffons‚Äô Ashlyn Finarty cranked a go-ahead two-run home run to centerfield, proving to be the game winning run(s) scored.

In game two, the Rambelles flipped the script. Angelo State scored six runs in the bottom of the fourth inning en route to an early 8-1 lead. ASU added an additional run in the bottom of the sixth inning, which proved to be the game‚Äôs final play. Greysen Collins‚Äô RBI single to left field drove in another run to increase the Rambelles‚Äô lead to eight, thus ending the game via run rule.

The Rambelles begin day two of the George & Ola McCorkle Challenge on Saturday, Feb 7. Angelo State faces Missouri Western first at 1:15 p.m. CST, followed by Ouachita Baptist at 3:30 p.m. CST.

title: Winnipeg's Seth Jarvis to Join Canada in Italy at Olympics
description: Winnipeg's Seth Jarvis steps in for an injured star, bringing his scoring touch to Canada's Olympic hockey quest in Italy.
fullText:
The Manitoba contingent at the 2026 Winter Olympic Games from Italy has grown one individual stronger.

Late on Thursday, Winnipeg's Seth Jarvis was asked to join the Canadian men's national hockey team as an injury replacement for injured forward Brayden Point.

Point, who was a lock for Jon Cooper's national team since the 4 Nations Face-Off, hurt his knee in early-January and will be forced to miss what would be his first Olympics.

So, the pride of Winnipeg will join Elkhorn's Travis Sanheim and fellow Winnipegger Mark Stone on the men's team, while Ste. Anne's Jocelyne Larocque and Oakbank's Kati Tabin will be on the women's team playing for gold.

Jarvis, 24, has scored 25 times and added another 18 assists in 48 games for Carolina this season. He has 121 goals and 256 points in 352 regular season games in his career.

He signed a monster eight-year, $63 million contract extension with the Hurricanes in late-summer of 2024.

Team Canada is set to begin its Olympic tournament against Czechia on Thursday, February 12.

title: ‚ÄòThe Best Gift Of My Life‚Äô ‚Äì Gabriela Fujimoto Eyes Birthday Finish At ONE Fight Night 40
description: The Brazilian wants to celebrate her birthday with a debut win ‚Äì and she explains why she'll do it on February 13!
fullText:
Gabriela Fujimoto couldn‚Äôt have scripted a more perfect ONE Championship debut.

The undefeated Brazilian will celebrate her birthday in the most memorable way possible when she faces Malaysian star Jihin ‚ÄúShadow Cat‚Äù Radzuan in an atomweight MMA clash at ONE Fight Night 40: Buntan vs. Hemetsberger II on Friday, February 13.

This spectacle will air live in U.S. primetime from the iconic Lumpinee Stadium in Bangkok, Thailand.

The KO Squad product brings a pristine 7-0 professional record into the world‚Äôs largest martial arts organization, with four of those victories coming via spectacular finish.

Growing up in Mogi das Cruzes, S√£o Paulo, and later relocating to Rio de Janeiro, Fujimoto has steadily climbed the South American MMA ranks. Now, she takes the biggest step of her career by making her first promotional appearance on the most meaningful date possible.

The undefeated Brazilian sensation revealed:

‚ÄúI will be making my debut at the event on my birthday. It‚Äôs the first time this has ever happened, and it will certainly be the best gift of my life.‚Äù

Beyond the birthday coincidence, this fight represents another milestone that holds special significance for the 22-year-old athlete.

Competing internationally has been a long-held dream, and stepping onto the global stage fulfills an ambition she‚Äôs carried throughout her martial arts journey.

The magnitude of leaving Brazil to compete at Lumpinee Stadium in Bangkok ‚Äì one of combat sports‚Äô most iconic venues ‚Äì isn‚Äôt lost on Fujimoto.

‚ÄúThe fact that this is my first time leaving my country to fight is something I‚Äôve always dreamed of.‚Äù

Standing between Fujimoto and her magnificent birthday celebration is 27-year-old Radzuan, a Wushu World Champion and submission specialist who has been a mainstay of the women‚Äôs atomweight MMA division.

The Malaysian rockstar has compiled eight victories throughout her promotional tenure. ‚ÄúShadow Cat,‚Äù however, enters this clash navigating a difficult period, as she has lost three of her last four bouts.

For Fujimoto, facing a veteran with Radzuan‚Äôs experience and accolades provides a solid litmus test. A victory over an established ONE Championship athlete would immediately position the Brazilian among the atomweight division‚Äôs top contenders.

When asked about her fighting style and approach, Fujimoto offered:

‚ÄúI consider myself a versatile athlete, capable of adapting throughout the fight. My favorite techniques are grappling-focused: takedowns and ground-and-pound.

‚ÄúI am a fighter who takes advantage of opportunities. I don‚Äôt prioritize a specific outcome, only capitalizing on what presents itself. My varied record reflects that. I believe this fight is wide open, but it will end before 15 minutes.‚Äù

Gabriela Fujimoto has spent considerable time studying Jihin Radzuan‚Äôs previous performances, analyzing the Malaysian‚Äôs strengths and identifying potential weaknesses to exploit at ONE Fight Night 40.

‚ÄúShadow Cat‚Äôs‚Äù familiarity with the Global Mixed Martial Arts Rule Set gives her a significant advantage. However, Fujimoto believes her own preparation and adaptability will neutralize that edge, creating a competitive battle that could swing in either direction based on strategy.

The Brazilian sensation explained:

‚ÄúI have watched some of her previous fights. She is already familiar with ONE‚Äôs rules, she is very skilled in several areas, and it will definitely be a very dynamic fight.

‚ÄúShe has good cardio and is capable of maintaining the same pace for all three rounds. I believe we have that in common, so it will be decided by small details.‚Äù

The Brazilian expects an intense showdown that will be determined by whoever can capitalize on the smallest mistakes. However, the Rio de Janeiro native has highlighted potential vulnerabilities she plans to exploit.

Fujimoto concluded her pre-fight assessment with confidence in her preparation:

‚ÄúI believe she leaves openings in some positions that will allow me to impose my game.‚Äù

title: Virginia Tech vs. N.C. State: How to watch, TV and odds
description: Here‚Äôs how you can watch today‚Äôs ACC matchup between the Hokies and Wolfpack.
fullText:
After a much-needed week off, the Virginia Tech Hokies (16-7, 5-5) are back on the hardwood for a noon tipoff Saturday in Raleigh against the North Carolina State Wolfpack (17-6, 8-2). This game kicks off a critical stretch for the Hokies, who will face the Wolfpack on Saturday, followed by games against No. 20 Clemson, Florida State and Miami over the next 10 days. Clemson, N.C. State and Miami are all ahead of the Hokies in the ACC standings.

The Wolfpack are not yet a lock for the NCAA Tournament, but are trending in that direction. They‚Äôve won five in a row and seven of their last eight games, with their most impressive wins coming against Clemson and SMU.

N.C. State features a balanced offense with at least four players averaging 13 points per game. Senior forward Derrion Williams leads the Pack, averaging 15 per game. The Wolfpack‚Äôs top interior scorer is senior Van-Allen Lubin, while the trio of Paul McNeil Jr., Quadir Copeland and Tre Holloman make up an impressive backcourt.

We learned some unfortunate news on Thursday when Virginia Tech head coach Mike Young said sophomore guard Tyler Johnson would be out again for the Hokies on Saturday. Last weekend, Young was optimistic that Johnson would play against the Wolfpack. Unfortunately, Young said he wasn‚Äôt quite ready, but he is on track to return soon in Tech‚Äôs current stretch of games.

Junior forward Amani Hansberry leads the Hokies in scoring at 15 points per game, while sophomore guard Ben Hammond (12.8), freshman Neoklis Avdalas (12.5), Tobi Lawal (11.1) and Jailen Bedford (11.0) are all scoring in double figures. Junior guard Jaden Schutt averages almost nine points per game off the bench. Johnson averages 10 points and five rebounds per game, but has missed the last 10 games.

A key for the Hokies is preventing the Wolfpack from taking uncontested 3-pointers. N.C. State is 11th in college basketball in 3-pointers made per game and shoots 40.1% from beyond the arc, which ranks 7th nationally.

Here‚Äôs how you can watch Saturday‚Äôs game:

When: Saturday, February 7, 2026

Where: Lenovo Center, Raleigh, North Carolina

Announcers: Tom Werme and John Henson

Radio: Virginia Tech Sports Network Radio. You can find a list of affiliates¬†here.

Betting odds: The Wolfpack are a 10.5-point favorite, according to FanDuel.

title: Score Predictions: Can Sunderland Shock The Gunners?
description: A trip to the Emirates is always tough, but can the Lads upset the odds in North London today?
fullText:
Score prediction: Arsenal 2 Sunderland 2

Sunderland‚Äôs first goalscorer: Habib Diarra

Arsenal aren‚Äôt invincible at home, as Manchester United proved recently, so there‚Äôs no reason we can‚Äôt get something in North London.

Of course it‚Äôs going to be an incredibly tough game, but it‚Äôs one the Lads will relish and it‚Äôs as free a hit as we‚Äôll get this season.

I‚Äôm going for 2-2, with Habib adding another goal to his tally to open for us.

Score prediction: Arsenal 1 Sunderland 1

Sunderland‚Äôs first goalscorer: Habib Diarra

The Lads did really well at home on Monday and gave themselves a bit of a bye for this as a result. If we‚Äôd lost to Burnley the pressure would be on, but we were ace and they were shit, so all good.

I honestly think we can also get something from the Liverpool home game, which I‚Äôm chuffed to have tickets for.

Today is about trying to do as well as we can, picking up no injuries and seeing what we can get on an away trip which is as hard as they get (and I say that considering the Mags game as well, as they‚Äôre falling apart at the seams just now, both on and off the pitch)

Get a point and come home for a game against the Scousers in the week with a full compliment please, boys ‚Äî and maybe a wee cameo for Nilson Angulo. That would be nice.

Score prediction: Arsenal 1 Sunderland 1

Sunderland‚Äôs first goalscorer: Enzo Le F√©e

It was great to bounce back resoundingly against Burnley, with a really professional and clinical display. In particular, (nearly) two goals from Habib Diarra was fantastic for the lad, who alongside Chemsdine Talbi looked like brand new signings after their AFCON absence.

Going away to title-chasing Arsenal will be a tough affair, but they had a game midweek against Chelsea and are potentially missing Bukayo Saka and Martin √òdegaard, which should give us a boost.

Let‚Äôs also not forget how we bullied them in the reverse fixture and that we‚Äôll likely approach this meeting in the same manner. They‚Äôll hate us getting in their faces and pushing them around, and we‚Äôll need our usual suspects ‚Äî Dan Ballard, Nordi Mukiele, Brian Brobbey, to name a few ‚Äî getting stuck in and hassling these lads.

It‚Äôa a very tough place to go but I know we can give them a real game ‚Äî and why not leave with a point for our troubles?

Score prediction: Arsenal 3 Sunderland 0

Sunderland‚Äôs first goalscorer: N/A

This is about as hard as it gets. That said, we‚Äôve shown this season that we don‚Äôt roll over, especially against the better sides.

If we stay organised, keep our discipline, and make it awkward for them, we can give them something to think about. We‚Äôve already proved we can compete at this level, and this is another chance to test ourselves.

If it doesn‚Äôt quite fall for us, so be it, but there‚Äôs no reason we can‚Äôt make a proper game of it.

Score prediction: Arsenal 1 Sunderland 0

Sunderland‚Äôs first goalscorer: N/A

It was a fantastic result on Monday and we rarely got out of first gear, but Arsenal will be an entirely different beast.

They might‚Äôve lost their first home game against Manchester United the other week, but they‚Äôre still flying high in all competitions.

Whilst our home form is flawless, we‚Äôve really struggled on the road and to take anything from this would be a phenomenal result. I was tempted to back a draw but I feel Arsenal will have too much for us today.

Score prediction: Arsenal 1 Sunderland 1

Sunderland‚Äôs first goalscorer: Wilson Isidor

I think we‚Äôll be well up for this after Monday night.

We have to ensure complacency doesn‚Äôt creep in ‚Äî and I think Arsenal won‚Äôt take this as lightly as they did at the Stadium of Light.

That said, I reckon we‚Äôll give them a proper game. They‚Äôll score early on and keep the ball for about seventy five minutes, then we‚Äôll nick one towards the end.

Score prediction: Arsenal 2 Sunderland 0

Sunderland‚Äôs first goalscorer: N/A

It was a relief to set things straight immediately after a poor result at West Ham ‚Äî particularly with the next two fixtures being Arsenal and Liverpool. It was also a great boost that we did it without captain Granit Xhaka, but I‚Äôm pretty gutted for him to miss out on a trip to his former employers.

We gave Arsenal a hell of a game at the Stadium of Light back in November, but I feel this is a very different proposition away from home, where we‚Äôve picked up just two wins all season.

We‚Äôll undoubtedly put up a fight again but we‚Äôre up against the league leaders, who still have the stingiest defence and are the second highest scorers. We do have a tendency of elevating our game against the big clubs, but I‚Äôm struggling to see anything but a comfortable Arsenal win today.

Score prediction: Arsenal 1 Sunderland 2

Sunderland‚Äôs first goalscorer: Dan Ballard

Arsenal: Top of the Premier League, top of the Champions League, through to the League Cup final and still in the FA Cup.

Sunderland: Seventeenth on away form.

This will be tough and the likelihood is that we‚Äôll lose this one, but where‚Äôs the fun in that?

Go big or go home. Haway the lads!!

Let‚Äôs keep this short: Sunderland were great and Burnley were bloody awful.

We got three goals, could‚Äôve had six, and they didn‚Äôt register a shot on target at all.

Whilst we wish relegation on no club, if they‚Äôre down, it‚Äôs one less spot we need to worry about ‚Äî although that isn‚Äôt a very big concern any more. We‚Äôre looking up way more than down.

The next game can get us points towards the top eight and Europe, and after the next two we have a decent run where we can compete and win some good points for sure, so if we get very little in North London, that‚Äôs OK.

Bring those points home, lads ‚Äî be that one or three.

A couple of the lads called a draw due to the potential banana skin, but the rest all called a win.

Nobody went for 3-0, with Gair very unlucky to not get three points as the lads looked good for four or five but didn‚Äôt score any more.

So, no perfect four-pointers, but a smattering of single points across the table.

No points for first scorer either ‚Äî whether we gave ‚Äúfirst scorer‚Äù to Habib Diarra for his first (OG) or his second, nobody picked him.

We now have a three way tie between Gary, Malc and Will, after Gary got nothing but the chasing duo got a point each.

Brett is hanging in close too, and only three points split fifth and seventh.

Gair is now only four points behind Martin, and doesn‚Äôt generally back similar outcomes to our Mackem down under, so that could be a battle to watch.

Just a quick reminder of how we allocate points to our match-by-match predictions:

Correct outcome (but not correct score) = One point

Correct first Sunderland goalscorer = One point (no goalscorer is a valid call)

Possible deductions for being lazy and not submitting on time = a two-point deduction.

title: Match Preview: Arsenal v Sunderland ‚Äî Tough Task For The Lads In The Capital!
description: Can the lads take something from one of the toughest tests of the season?
fullText:
TV/Stream: Full live match coverage is unavailable.

Radio: Full live match commentary available via BBC Radio Newcastle (not online)

Don‚Äôt forget to follow the blow-by-blow account of the game on the Roker Report Twitter feed (@RokerReport) and check out the player ratings after the full-time whistle at www.RokerReport.sbnation.com!

Well, we only went and did it again on Monday. We‚Äôve lost six times this season ‚Äì all away from home ‚Äì and on each occasion we‚Äôve followed that up with a win at the Stadium of Light. This means half of our 36-point total so far has come from bouncing back from a defeat on our travels.

What does the pattern look like after we played that game? ‚Äì I hear you ask ‚Äì well, it‚Äôs quite interesting because of those previous five wins that prove our bouncebackability (one for the older people maybe‚Ä¶), only one of those wins was followed by a defeat, which was our last road trip at West Ham.

There were three draws in there (Brighton, Liverpool & Palace), but the other was a victory on the road ‚Äì our last one to be precise. We were beaten at Old Trafford, and followed it up with a win at Wolves, then went to Stamford Bridge and took all three points. So there is hope after all today.

There has been some focus on the away form, but the mix of opponents is interesting. You could argue that our last almost complete performance away from home came at Liverpool, and since then, we‚Äôve maybe had a little expectation on us to go and attack and take all three points. But in trips to Liverpool and Chelsea, this wasn‚Äôt the case ‚Äì so it will be interesting to see what Le Bris has up his sleeve today.

Well, it doesn‚Äôt get much harder than our fixture this weekend as we travel to Premier League leaders Arsenal.

They are on a mission to claim their first league title since 2004, having finished runners-up for the previous three seasons. They have also won all eight games in the Champions League on their way to the last sixteen and reached the League Cup final after navigating a tricky semi-final second leg against Chelsea in midweek, plus they are due to take on Wigan Athletic at home in the fourth round of the FA Cup, so it could be a busy few months ahead.

If that wasn‚Äôt all, by the way, they‚Äôve also conceded the fewest goals in the Premier League and only Citeh have scored more, but despite all of that, you would think it was all going wrong at the Emirates if you listen too carefully to a lot of broadcasters and social media at the moment.

Paul Scholes was saying they would end up being the most boring side to have ever won the Premier League, but would Arteta or the fans care? I very much doubt it. But they have to go and do it now, because if they don‚Äôt and finish second for a fourth time in a row, it will start to get a little silly.

The bookies have the Lads at 12/1 to win the game, while Arsenal are priced at 2/9, and the draw is 5/1.

[Nketiah 17‚Äô, 49‚Äô, 58‚Äô, Pepe 27‚Äô, Patino 90‚Äô ‚Äì Broadhead 31‚Äô]

Sunderland: Burge, Winchester, Wright, Flanagan, Doyle, Gooch (Evans), Neil, Embleton (O‚ÄôBrien), Pritchard, Broadhead (Hume), Stewart (Kimpioka) Substitutes not used: Patterson, Cirkin, Xhemajli, Younger, Dunne

Arsenal: Leno, Soares, Tavares, Elneny, White (Gabriel), Holding, Pepe, Odegaard (Martinelli), Nketiah, Smith-Rowe (Patino), Balogun (Xhaka) Substitutes not used: Ramsdale, Tierney, Partey, Saka, Lacazette

I reckon the lads will put in a good shift ‚Äì but they‚Äôre pretty good at the moment.

title: Will Bengals play 2026 international game? Ja'Marr Chase wants to know
description: The Bengals are expected to be a host team for an international game in 2027, executive vice president Katie Blackburn said last year.
fullText:
Cincinnati Bengals receiver Ja'Marr Chase is like many fans.

He just wants to know if the Bengals are going to get an international game in 2026.

"Bengals playing out the country this year @NFL ?" Chase tweeted late Feb. 6.

The Cincinnati Bengals' opponents for the 2026 NFL regular season were determined by the team's third-place finish in the AFC North. With an extra road game on their schedule, it is expected that they would be the road team in an international matchup, if they're selected for one.

Executive vice president Katie Blackburn said in 2025 that the Bengals are expected to be a¬†host team for an international game in 2027.

Rumors swirled during the first few months of 2025 about the Bengals playing the Dolphins in Madrid. Despite quarterback Joe Burrow's Instagram plea, it did not materialize.

The San Francisco 49ers and Los Angeles Rams are scheduled to meet at Melbourne Cricket Ground. It would be the first regular-season NFL game ever played in Australia.

The Dallas Cowboys are scheduled to play a TBD opponent at Maracana Stadium in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. It would be the NFL's first regular-season game in Rio.

The New Orleans Saints are scheduled to face a TBD opponent in Paris, France.

London, England is scheduled to host three regular-season games across the city. Matchups TBD.

Munich, Germany is scheduled to host one regular-season game. Matchup TBD.

Madrid, Spain is expected to host one regular-season game. Matchup TBD.

Mexico City, Mexico is expected to host one regular-season game. Matchup TBD.

title: Suns inch toward health, then take another hit ahead of matchup against 76ers
description: PHOENIX ‚Äî The Phoenix Suns‚Äô injury report ahead of Saturday‚Äôs matchup against the Philadelphia 76ers has a mix of encouraging developments and challenges that will test their depth. Devin Booker and Jalen Green are both listed as questionable as they continue their respective returns from injury.
fullText:
PHOENIX ‚Äî The Phoenix Suns‚Äô injury report ahead of Saturday‚Äôs matchup against the Philadelphia 76ers has a mix of encouraging developments and challenges that will test their depth.

Devin Booker and Jalen Green are both listed as questionable as they continue their respective returns from injury. Booker (right ankle sprain) sat out recent games after rolling his ankle on Jan. 23 against the Atlanta Hawks. Green (right hamstring injury management and left hip contusion) is nursing his injuries after landing on his hip after a scary fall on Jan. 30 against the Cleveland Cavaliers.

Green has appeared in just a handful of games due to injury, limiting his impact alongside Booker and the Suns‚Äô rotation.

Jan 23, 2026; Atlanta, Georgia, USA; Phoenix Suns guard Jalen Green (4) dribbles against the Atlanta Hawks in the first quarter at State Farm Arena. Mandatory Credit: Brett Davis-Imagn Images

However, the club will be without two key rotation contributors.

Grayson Allen (right knee sprain) and Isaiah Livers (left shoulder sprain) have both been ruled out for Saturday‚Äôs game. Allen exited Thursday‚Äôs matchup against the Golden State Warriors late in the game, while Livers‚Äô injury happened during the second quarter.

Feb 5, 2026; Phoenix, Arizona, USA; Phoenix Suns guard Grayson Allen (8) reacts after suffering an injury against the Golden State Warriors in the second half at Mortgage Matchup Center. Mandatory Credit: Mark J. Rebilas-Imagn Images

Both Allen and Livers have provided valuable minutes this season ‚Äî Allen, in particular, has stepped into a starting role at times with Booker and Green sidelined ‚Äî making their absences notable as the Suns attempt to find offensive balance and defensive cohesion.

If either Booker or Green is unable to play, the Suns will need production from secondary scorers and bench pieces to stay competitive.

Feb 5, 2026; Phoenix, Arizona, USA; Phoenix Suns forward Isaiah Livers (18) reacts after suffering an injury against the Golden State Warriors in the first half at Mortgage Matchup Center. Mandatory Credit: Mark J. Rebilas-Imagn Images

Phoenix and Philidelphia tipoff on Saturday, Feb. 7, at 7 p.m.

title: Starting XI: Same Again For Sunderland At Arsenal This Afternoon?
description: Or will new signing Nilson Angulo make a surprise start today?
fullText:
A ‚Äòtough and exciting challenge‚Äô is how Regis Le Bris describes today‚Äôs game at Arsenal, and on paper, this is our biggest challenge of the season against a team that looks like the champions in waiting. There‚Äôs room for positivity, however ‚Äì¬†Arsenal have only won one in their last four league games, three of which have been at home, so they‚Äôre not invincible. We, however, will need to be at our very best to have any chance at all, and we need to be a million times better than we were on our last trip to London a couple of weeks ago. New signing Nilson Angulo is in contention to be part of the matchday squad, and I expect we‚Äôll see him start on the bench. With Xhaka still out, and Diarra and Talbi shining on Monday against Burnley, I can‚Äôt see any changes to the team that started last time out at the Stadium of Light.

Roefs probably won‚Äôt have an easier game in his career than he had on Monday night ‚Äì it would be nice to think he‚Äôll have a quiet afternoon today, but in all likelihood, he‚Äôs going to be hugely tested at The Emirates, and he‚Äôs going to have to be at his best.

Reinildo returned to form against Burnley and his experience will be vital today. I‚Äôm looking forward to seeing Dan Ballard on his return to the club he started at, and he‚Äôll likely form the centre of defence with Omar Alderete, with Nordi Mukiele completing the back four.

I thought Trai Hume was fortunate to keep his place on Monday, and if Geertruida hadn‚Äôt been linked with Liverpool in the lead up to the Burnley game he may not have started ‚Äì but he played very well and will retain his place in that hybrid midfield/wing/defence position. Noah Sadiki and Enzo Le Fee played will in the centre of the field and they‚Äôll likely stay in those positions, with Diarra given licence to join the attack, and Talbi providing attacking flair and hard work from the left of the midfield.

The man mountain will start again up front and after grabbing an equaliser at the Stadium of Light against the Gunners a couple of months ago, he‚Äôll be keen to get on the scoresheet again. I love watching Brobbey play, and with Diarra getting close to him and providing an attacking link-up option, I think we‚Äôll see him offer more and more over the coming weeks.

title: On This Day (7th Feb 2015): Poyet Praises Defoe After Draw At Swansea
description: Jermain Defoe was impressing his new manager after another goal at the Liberty Stadium!
fullText:
A draw is never a bad result away from home but after the way Sunderland had played in the first half, manager Gus Poyet was left regretting a missed opportunity for a rare three points on the road.

Poyet‚Äôs side played magnificently well in the first half, where they seemed to be a more confident side with the presence of a proper centre forward in the team. This aforementioned striker was of course Jermain Defoe, who had only recently joined the club from Toronto FC in the MLS, and had only got off the mark a week earlier at the Stadium of Light against Burnley.

With Defoe on the side, Sunderland had a focal point and a player who knew where the net was. This pleased Poyet who thought his side could have kicked on after their first half display where a typical Defoe goal that included quick feet, a cut inside and a snap shot put us in front.

‚ÄúIt was a shame at the end but we were very good in the first half and that can give us the confidence to keep getting results.‚Äù

Despite being under pressure for the majority of the second half, the away side held on thanks to the exploits of their goalkeeper Costel Pantilimon who was in outstanding form to keep many Swansea opportunites out.

Unfortunately, they were haunted by a former Sunderland player when Ki Sung-yeung levelled the game after Defoe‚Äôs opener. As was becoming a trend throughout the season, he easily got away from a Sunderland defender (John O‚ÄôShea) to head into the net from close range.

Whilst the Swans tried to pressure the Sunderland goal, we held on for a valuable point and after the game, there was more talk about the new Black Cats centre forward Defoe who was looking sharper with every game that passed after four months of now matches in the MLS.

Such was his form that Poyet stated his team were a ‚Äòdifferent side‚Äô with him in it and suggested that even England manager may look at Defoe for the upcoming European Championships in France.

‚ÄúWhen you pick strikers you pick those in form and scoring goals,‚Äù

‚ÄúWe saw today Harry Kane at Spurs and it‚Äôs an obvious choice, but Jermain has a chance if Wayne Rooney plays in midfield. But that‚Äôs up to Roy [Hodgson] to decide. I respect the manager of the national team and the only thing the player can do is perform.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhen you‚Äôve got a player sooner or later that you know is going to score it makes the rest of the team believe that you‚Äôve got a chance to win football games.

In many ways, the best from Defoe was yet to come with bigger performances and goals ahead in the rest of this season but especially the following season when Big Sam Allardyce came through the revolving door of managers at the club.

Additionally, Poyet was correct that Defoe‚Äôs form for his club eventually brought him into the England frame where Gareth Southgate rewarded his form for the club.
